page.title: 03TRANSPORT-EVESHAM BY-PASS
page.content: For many years{Evesham}has been asking for a{by-pass}to divert traffic from the town centre and so relieve congestion upon the town's two bridges. The by-pass, which has in{1985}been given the final{'go-ahead'}will entail the building of a new bridge on the Offenham side of Evesham. The new road will,in the area,run from between Bengeworth and Badsey,across mainly orchard land and crossing the river between Oxstall's Farm and the Offenham ferry. Growers in that area are unhappy about the division and the compulsary purchase of their prime market gardening land although compensation wil be awarded to them. This has been a local issue for many years and now appears,in 1986,to be coming to a head.
